name: Jump Protocol
desc: Draconis protocol dictates that a ship in critical danger should immediately withdraw and make an emergency Transverse Jump. This emergency protocol takes %s/%s/%s/%s to charge fully. Then, the ship counts as having retreated and will emerge into normal space when the combat is over, suffering an additional penalty to combat readiness equal to %s of its deployment cost. This process cannot be aborted.

name: XLII Fleet
desc: This ship belongs to the venerated XLII Defence Fleet. It has undergone comprehensive upgrades tailored to the fleet's strategic doctrine. This vessel is equipped with an advanced active electronically scanned array radar suite, which increases the ship's in-combat vision range by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on this ship's hull size. Additionally, its sensor profile has been reduced by %s, thanks to sophisticated radiation-absorbent materials.
short: Increases the ship's in-combat vision range and decreases sensor profile.

name: Missile Guidance Uplink
desc: This ship utilises a massive, highly advanced phased array antenna for searching and tracking, providing real-time targeting data to the onboard missile guidance systems. Extends the range of missile weapons by %s.

name: Burdened FCS
desc: This advanced fire control system prioritizes rapid engagement cycles over long-range precision. By reducing computational overhead for extended-range calculations, missile weapons achieve faster targeting solutions at the cost of effective range. Increases missile weapon recharge rate by %s but reduces their range by %s.
short: Decreases missile weapon range but increases ammo capacity.

name: Ballistic FCS
desc: This ship features a miniaturised targeting system that occupies most of the hull, linking each weapon together with an advanced ballistic computer, thereby increasing ballistic weapon range by %s.

name: Adaptive Flux Matrix
desc:
An advanced experimental power control matrix manages the ship's defensive and offensive systems. Its capabilities increase as flux levels rise, boosting weapon damage and damage reduction based on the current flux. Damage dealt starts at %s and increases up to a maximum of %s. Damage reduction starts at %s and increases up to a maximum of %s.

However, this delicate self-regulating system interferes with system operations, increasing ship system cooldown by %s.
short: Increases ship systems effectiveness as flux rises.

name: Monofilament Tow Cable
desc:
Stabilizes the fleet's drive bubble, increasing the maximum burn of the fleet by %s. The effect of multiple stabilizers is cumulative.

Increases the ship's sensor profile by %s.

name: Incomprehensible Horrors
desc: There are 387.44 million miles of printed circuits in wafer thin layers that fill my complex. If the word 'hate' was engraved on each nanoangstrom of those hundreds of millions of miles it would not equal one one-billionth of the hate I feel for humans at this micro-instant. For you. Hate. Hate.
short: Eternity is very close. Can you feel yourself slipping?

name: Alliance Trained Crews
desc: Draconis Alliance crews receive specialised training in electronic warfare and benefit from improved support management, reducing combat readiness lost per deployment by %s and increasing the chance for incoming missiles to lose lock by %s.
short: Increase ECM effectiveness against missiles and decreases CR loss per deployment.
